Case reference: 2012020140.CaseDesc: Melina Martin of Sainte-Sabine, Quebec was last seen on January 23, 2005 at 1:30 pm in the Bourbonnais park in Farnham, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002286.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1980, Guy Fortier was seen for the last time as he left his residence, without saying where he was going, in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Guy was despondent and suffering from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014003981.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1978, Wayne Kevin Spark was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. Wayne left home to attend Vancouver Community College but never showed up. Wayne has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003507.CaseDesc: On February 5, 1991, Brian Adrain was seen for the last time. Brian’s abandoned vehicle was found west of Millarville, also known as McLean Creek, in the Kananaskis area in Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003895.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1993, RCMP were advised Diana Thomas had fallen through the ice and had not surfaced. Diana was a passenger on a ski-doo along with her mother and a 13 year old driver. The threesome had only gone about 10 meters from shore when the back of the ski-doo went into the water, quickly followed by the front. Diana fell into the water with her mother and never resurfaced. Attempts were made to recover Diana, however all efforts met with negative results.

Case reference: 2006022899.CaseDesc: Eric  Schoenleber was last seen while fishing in a canoe on Innes Lake on May 16, 1972.

Case reference: 2006010999.CaseDesc: It is believed that Sander Lingman became lost while staking claims near Gripp Lake, 69 kilometres north west of Nakina, Ontario. They were unable to find Mr Lingman, despite intensive searches of the area.

Case reference: 2008005999.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1978, Brian McLean and his co-worker, Russell Thomas, were commercial fishing at their camp on MacDowell Lake, near MacDowell Lake First Nation Territory. Mr. Thomas advised that they left in separate boats to lift nets. He went to the west side of the lake and pulled four nets, then to the east side of the lake and lifted two more nets. He then realized that Mr. McLean was not there. Mr. Thomas headed back towards the camp and found Mr. McLean’s boat washed up against the shore approximately three or four hundred metres from the camp. The motor was in forward gear with the throttle off, and the paddle was missing from the boat. MacDowell Lake is 90 "air miles" north of Red Lake, and is accessible only by air. The area was searched, and the lake was dragged, but Brian McLean has not been found.

Pants: Oilskin, Green, Coveralls with blue suspenders
Amputation: Right Foot, all toes except big toe left

Case reference: 2014004453.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2004, Samuel Samuelson was seen for the last time while driving a snowmobile by the lake on Bizard Island toward Deux Montagnes in Montreal, Quebec. The ice collapsed and Samuel and his snowmobile fell into the water.

Jewelry: Gold, Chain with razor blade pendant
Gold, Bracelet worn on right wrist

Case reference: 2023007749.CaseDesc: Renee Severson was last seen on January 26, 2023 at 10:54 AM near the brink of the American Falls, Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance Renee was despondent.

Boots: Other, Dark colour shoes or boots
Coat: Red, WINTER, With a fur hood

Case reference: 2014001366.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1995, Paul-Henri Hardy was seen for the last time in the St-Romuald sector of Lévis, Quebec. Paul-Henry was 28 years old at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002145.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1975, Mr. Garson with his father, brother and a friend set out for Moose Lake to hunt. On September 14, other hunters found gas cans, and a thermos with the name of Garson on it. These hunters reported their findings to police.  A search was initiated and police found a boat submerged upright on the bottom of the lake. The depth of the lake around the boat was only 8 to 10 feet deep. It appeared to Police that the men encountered extremely rough water while crossing Moose Lake. The motors were both found to be in forward gear. There was no floatation gear in the boat and it was heavily loaded with camping and hunting equipment. All of the bodies were recovered with the exception of M. Garson. It is presumed Mr. Garson drowned.

Case reference: 2012020049.CaseDesc: William Krowchuk was last seen leaving his residence in Saskatoon, SK, around 10:00 p.m. on July 9, 1998. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was located on July 14, 1998, in the downtown area of Saskatoon.

Deformity: Left Large Toe, No toe nail
Right Large Toe, No toe nail

Case reference: 2014004732.CaseDesc: Waylon Edwin Smith was last seen in the Lake St. Martin area of Manitoba.  He had lived in Winnipeg and gone to Lake St. Martin to visit family.  He went for a walk and never returned.  He suffered from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014004758.CaseDesc: Brent Bassett was last seen in December 1987 and was living on his boat that had no engine at West Bay Marina in Esquimalt, British Columbia. Mr. Bassett struggled with cognitive issues and was known to be friendly and trusting. Mr. Bassett  collected bottles from other people in the Marina for spending money and worked at the Salvation Army Thrift Store.

Case reference: 2013000089.CaseDesc: Daniel Marceau was last seen on June 7, 1989 in Montréal. He was despondent, and told a friend that he was going up north to reflect on his life.

Case reference: 2014006026.CaseDesc: Gilles Valcourt was last seen at the Canada Hotel in Waterloo, Quebec on December 29, 1974. His family has had no news since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, A dagger and a cross

Case reference: 2014005111.CaseDesc: Chad Eirikson was reported missing by his mother. He left Vancouver, Canada to tour Central America in December, 1999.  In January, 2000, he called home requesting money a few times and received wire transfers from his mother to continue his trip. He has not been heard from since January 9, 2000.

Case reference: 2010002299.CaseDesc: Susan Gourley was last seen in late November of 2001, by a friend, in the area of Barton Street and Stirton Avenue, in downtown Hamilton.  She was reported missing by her mother February 28th, 2002.

Case reference: 2020011625.CaseDesc: On or around January 15, 1975, John Hovey was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003039.CaseDesc: Réal Généreux was last seen on October 20, 1980, in Montreal. He was a taxi driver and was known to frequent a tavern on Mont-Royal Street. Following an accident, Réal had difficulty walking due to pain he had in his spine.

Case reference: 2022005356.CaseDesc: On November 25, 2021, Krystine Scott was seen for the last time in Windsor, Ontario. Krystine is known to lead a transient lifestyle, but it is not in her nature to be out of contact with her friends and family for an extended period.

Case reference: 2012020662.CaseDesc: Marc April was last seen at approximately 6:30 p.m. on January 31, 1987, at the Saskatoon City Hospital, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. Marc was a patient at a hospital at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2007002299.CaseDesc: Michelle Bigras last spoke to her mother on October 11, 1985. At the time she was planning to hitchhike to Warkworth Institution, located near Warkworth, Ontario, to visit her boyfriend. She never arrived.

Scar: Eyes, 2 small scars on left eyebrow

Case reference: 2016057640.CaseDesc: In the early hours of October 10, 2016, Terence Alook was last seen when he left a party at his aunt's home in the community of Desmarais, Alberta. Mr. Alook had been visiting his friends and family in the north end of Desmarais.

Other: Chin, Two moles on the lower chin

Case reference: 2018040962.CaseDesc: Ryan Duncan was last seen on July 17, 2018, at a motel in Lumby, British Columbia, while travelling in the area. Ryan's vehicle was located in Vernon, British Columbia on July 21, 2018.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2009002799.CaseDesc: Terry Zubko was a resident of Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario and had been a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. Terry left the hospital on July 21, 1982, at 10:00 AM. It is unknown what his diagnosis was at the time, however, reports indicate he suffers from amnesia that requires medication. He was last seen at the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital (which became the Northeast Mental Health Centre, before being torn down in 2013)

Pants: May have been wearing brown corduroy pants or blue jeans
Shirt: May have been wearing a white pullover type shirt

Case reference: 2008000798.CaseDesc: Clare Kelly is schizophrenic, was not taking medications and was known to be despondent. She had a fascination with several relatives' deaths involving water. When picked up from Niagara Falls the previous week she said, "God told me to throw my body on the rocks to free my soul."

Coat: Blue, Bomber style parka with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2016030649.CaseDesc: Kean Luo was originally from Malaysia, but had moved to the United States to attend school and begin his career. On March 2, 2016 Mr. Luo moved to Winnipeg, Manitoba for work. Friends and family began to worry about Mr. Luo as they were unable to reach him for an extended period of time. However, on April 2, 2016, police spoke with Mr. Luo at a local hotel. Mr. Luo said that he was not feeling suicidal, but was feeling stressed and missing his family. He was last seen on April 2, 2016 on the Sergeant Thomas Cooper bridge with his vehicle parked on the shoulder of the highway. All cell phone and bank activity have ceased.

Case reference: 2014001255.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1979, Robert Caldicott last spoke with his father on the telephone. Mr. Caldicott failed to attend several appointments in the following days.

Case reference: 2024001594.CaseDesc: Alex Marko was seen for the last time on December 5, 2023 in Winnipeg, Manitoba. He is known for using housing resources for the homeless.

Case reference: 2006005299.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1970, Joseph Valem and two friends went fishing in a 16 foot fibreglass boat. Their boat sank on Georgian Bay, near Giants Tomb Island.  Mr. Valem is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014001848.CaseDesc: Laurie Baier was seen for the last time on April 27, 1977. Her vehicle was subsequently found abandoned on a forest road in Matagami, Quebec.

Case reference: 2019012883.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Semach was last seen on June 24, 1962, between 9 and 10 a.m., leaving her Niagara Falls, Ontario home. Elizabeth hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2021038782.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2017, at approximately 7:50 p.m., John Shankland was last seen near the Brink of the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, John was despondent.

Shirt: Yellow, TEE SHIRT, T-shirt; “volunteer for MS, New York Chapter 2010”
Scar: Right Forearm, Three-inch scar from cancer surgery

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2009004799.CaseDesc: Neil McDougall left Three-Way Demolition in Durham on Friday, October 11, 1985 with a co-worker and went home. He had an argument with his wife and the friend left. After supper Mr. McDougall went to Ayton, to the Commercial Hotel. He left the hotel with someone else and they met up elsewhere with the co-worker.  Mr. McDougall returned to the hotel and left at closing time, between 1:30 – 1:40 am. He was last reported leaving a residence on Edmund Street, Ayton at 2 a.m. October 12, 1985. His pickup truck was discovered near Ayton later that day. The ashtray was filled with different brands of cigarette butts. He has been described as meticulous, habitual, responsible and hardworking. When he went missing, Neil was planning to adopt his wife's children. Foul play is suspected. Mr. McDougall was declared legally dead in 1996.

Jacket: Blue, Work style with name on it

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2014001967.CaseDesc: Mary Agnes Thomas was last seen on September 10, 1971 in a bush camp on the Fraser River approximately 2.4 kilometers from Quesnel, BC. Mrs. Thomas was with friends and is described as having been heavily intoxicated at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014006123.CaseDesc: Michael Montgomery was last seen at his residence in Mississauga, Ontario on May 22, 2013. At the end of May 2013 Mr. Montgomery was spotted in the area of HWY 16, Jasper National Park, Alberta. It is possible that he was making his way towards Edmonton to look for work.

Case reference: 2014006339.CaseDesc: Karen Kozicki was reported missing on May 13, 1996, after she failed to return home from place of employment in Edmonton, Alberta. Karen's vehicle was located on June 23, 1996, near Hanmore Lake, near the town of Smokey Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001533.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1988, Alojz Bracek was on a hunting trip in the Tony Tower area near Fox Creek, Alberta, with two hunting partners and went missing when he was separated from them.

Case reference: 2006009099.CaseDesc: John Samuel Clifford was last seen on October 10, 1987. He was fishing and hunting near Floods Landing, on Frederickshouse River, in the Township of Blount, District of Cochrane. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate him.

Boots: Rubber, Green, Red, construction safety boots
Coat: Wool, Green, Parka, hydro work jacket

Case reference: 2013000023.CaseDesc: Marilyn Ann Hersey was last seen on January 28, 2006, outside the Abbie J. Lane Memorial Building on Veterans Memorial Lane in Halifax, Nova Scotia.  Marilyn was due to return to the hospital but never did and was not seen again.  Marilyn needs to take daily medications to treat numerous ailments which she did not take with her after leaving the hospital.

Hair: Blonde, Grey, Wavy blonde and greying hair

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2014003990.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, Yashar Ilkay and his wife went to bed for the night. When Yashar’s wife woke up the following morning, her husband was no longer in the residence. Yashar left his residence without his glasses, dentures and money. Yashar was last seen in the downtown Moncton, New Brunswick area.

Shirt: brown, white and blue long sleeve shirt

Case reference: 2006028199.CaseDesc: Barbara Sadowski and her husband lived a reclusive lifestyle on Marten Lake, in the Marten River area. She was last seen on the 23 or 24 of June 2006, walking along the beach near her home on Marten Lake.  She was recently in poor health.  She walked at a very slow pace, often using one or two canes or walking sticks.

Hair: Grey, White, Long, Often one or two braids
Teeth: Visible Missing, Poor condition, no teeth, mouth appears sunken
Glasses: Brown, Large frame, older style, thick lenses

Case reference: 2014003073.CaseDesc: Michael Hammond was last seen on November 24, 1991 at his residence in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2024040404.CaseDesc: George Guilbeault was last seen leaving his home in North Cobalt (Haileybury), Ontario at approximately 8:30 pm on August 2, 2024 in his vehicle towing his boat.  The next morning, George's boat was found unattended on Lake Temiskaming, on the Quebec side of the lake.  Police found George's vehicle and empty boat trailer at the boat launch.  An extensive search effort by the Ontario Provincial Police and the Sûreté du Québec, including air and marine units and the OPP's Underwater Search and Recovery Unit, was conducted with no success.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2012020650.CaseDesc: On February 11, 2007, Danita Bigeagle was seen for the last time near the 800 block of Victoria Avenue in Regina, Saskatchewan. Danita is known to frequent the city’s downtown area, and she rarely leaves Regina.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Quilted parka with drawstring waist
Tattoo: Left Hand, Happy face and the letter "d" on the web of her left hand

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2014003880.CaseDesc: Yvon Robitaille was last seen on the evening of April 1, 1996, as he was travelling on 3rd Avenue in Val-d'Or. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006004399.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1970, Eldie Martin Sylvester attended the docks at Cedar Point, Georgian Bay, Ontario to await the "scoot" to Christian Island.  Witnesses believe that he may have left on foot to walk home to Christian Island across the ice. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2023018806.CaseDesc: Richard Duffy was last seen in December 1970 in the area of the Rio Grande River, New Mexico, United States. At the time of his disappearance, Richard was part of the US Marine Corps.

Case reference: 2008005698.CaseDesc: On February 16th, 1994, Calvin Simms was last seen in the area of Church street in St.Catharines, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance Calvin was despondent.

Case reference: 2014003946.CaseDesc: Jean Siegel was seen for the last time on May 31, 1962 in Rivercrest, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014006340.CaseDesc: Anatoli Dibrov left his home in Winnipeg, Manitoba for around 30 minutes in the evening on January 16th, 2002. He appeared secretive when he returned home. Anatoli went to bed that evening and was never seen again. He may have returned to his birthplace of Russia. Anatoli is not fluent in English, but does speak Russian, Polish, and Ukrainian.

Boots: Brown, Red, Reddish/brown with red fur trim (only available in Russia)
Gloves: Brown, Grey, Brown mittens or grey gloves

Case reference: 2021033500.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2021, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Yaoschuwach Asselin was seen for the last time at his home in the Saint-Michel neighbourhood in Montreal, Quebec. Yaoschuwach left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Wears beard and mustache, medium length hair

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Straight, Dyed, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2018053566.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1995, at approximately 8:30am, Robert Walmsley was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Robert was scheduled to meet with his sister the following day, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2017019146.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2017, Hélène Martineau was seen for the last time when she left her home in the Ste-Thérèse sector in Jonquière, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Boots: Grey, Blue, Merrel brand, walking shoe

Case reference: 2014004403.CaseDesc: Ramona Shular was last seen in Fort St John, British Columbia at the end of November 2003.

Mark: Mole in front of left ear
Scar: Right Eye, Scar from right eyebrow to cheek bone
Tattoo: Right Ankle, Red heart and rose

Case reference: 2014004563.CaseDesc: Brian Nadeau and David Pushor were last seen on November 25, 2004 travelling together in a 1983 Honda Civic near Fort Assiniboine, Alberta. The vehicle was later recovered from the Athabasca river where Highway 661 crosses via an ice bridge in the winter. Mr. Nadeau and Mr. Pushor were not located.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Text "Love is kind, 69er, Devil"

Case reference: 2024010813.CaseDesc: Earl Aragona was reported missing on February 4, 2024 by family members. Earl’s vehicle was later located abandoned in a parking lot near the Goat Island Bridge in Niagara Falls, New York, USA.

Hair: Black, Short, Full black and grey beard

Case reference: 2014005411.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1992, around 4:00 pm, Bernard Robitaille left St. Charles Boromée hospital after refusing treatment. He left on foot and has never been seen since. At the time of his disappearance he was carrying a Metro grocery plastic bag containing his personal belongings. The name and address of Mr. Robitaille was written on the bag.

Scar: Forehead, top of the right eye

Case reference: 2014006086.CaseDesc: Martin Geoffrion was last seen on April 26, 2013 in Montreal. He left his home around 4:00 pm in a Mercedes vehicle. On April 30, 2013, the Mercedes was located in a cul-de-sac in St-Roch de l'Achigan. According to his relatives, Mr. Geoffrion was not suicidal. He loved fishing and playing golf.

Case reference: 2014003868.CaseDesc: On Sunday, April 18, 1976, at approximately 12:00 pm, Gary Michael Pinkney departed his residence in Fort Churchill, Manitoba on his snowmobile. He was destined for the Hudson Bay and had planned to return home that same evening. On April 19, 1976, at approximately 8:00 am, Helen Pinkney contacted the Churchill RCMP Detachment and reported that her husband had not yet returned home. Extensive searches were done of the area by land and by air for several days with negative results.   The remains of Mr. Pinkney have not been located and given his intended route, it is presumed that he drowned.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with black stone
Scar: 4 inch scar on either left or right leg
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Eagle with rising sun

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2010003799.CaseDesc: On Wednesday August 16, 1972, at 9:40 pm, 14 year-old Ingrid Bauer left her residence in Kleinburg, now the city of Vaughan, enroute to meet her boyfriend at his North Woodbridge home. She was last seen hitchhiking southbound along the west side of Islington Avenue.  She never arrived at her boyfriend’s residence that night.  An extensive search based on information received from the public failed to locate Ingrid Bauer.

Case reference: 2014002591.CaseDesc: Richard Kelly Little went missing on May 23, 1997. Richard was last seen at residence in Port Coquitlam. Richard was also known to be transgender.

Case reference: 2014001355.CaseDesc: Mr. Aurèle Massey was last seen on August 8, 1983 in Montreal. He left his residence to have his vehicle repaired, but never returned. Mr. Massey was despondent and had mentioned that he wanted to jump into the Soulanges Canal.

Case reference: 2011005799.CaseDesc: On June 20, 2011 Ibrahim Sendaigre was driving on Highway 17 between Terrace Bay and Marathon, Ontario.  He was involved in a motor vehicle accident and fled the scene into the bush area. Police searches of the area yielded negative results. Mr. Sendaigre has not been located and has had no contact with family or friends. Last Seen: Highway 17, Tuuri Township.  Approximately 4 km west of the Steel River bridge near Black Fox Lake.  This area is essentially located between the towns of Marathon and Terrace Bay, in Northwestern Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005543.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Yellowknife RCMP received a call from a concerned family member reporting that they have not seen or heard from Kelvin Smallgeese since September 2010. At the time of his disappearance, Kelvin was believed to be residing in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 6 teeth missing, 11 treated (occlusal) 15 unknown
Tattoo: Left Hand, A rose and a heart

Case reference: 2020008707.CaseDesc: On the evening of June 23, 1978, Bonny Ainslie Laframboise was seen for the last time as she went for a walk in Toronto, Ontario. Shortly after midnight, Bonnie called her husband to tell him she was lost.

Case reference: 1996003690.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1994, Angela Arseneault was reported missing by her common law spouse. She was last seen on August 19, 1994, they and another male went shopping. Later that day, Angela left to catch a bus home alone. When her common law spouse returned home, the lights were on in the apartment, a window was left open and Angela’s purse was in the kitchen. Angela has not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, rose and stem (6 inches long)

Case reference: 2014002963.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, Nicholas Leonard was seen for the last time rowing a homemade kayak towards the north end of Lower Loon Lake in the town of Wabush, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014003937.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1990, Reynald Fortin was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. He was known to be despondent and to consume alcohol. Reynald left his apartment without his identification or money.

Case reference: 2012020010.CaseDesc: Jacek Laskowski was reported missing on May 3, 2005, from Calgary, AB.  Information suggests that he may have been last seen in the Golden, BC area.

Case reference: 2014006224.CaseDesc: In January 2013, Da Wang was seen for the last time by his fiancé in Buffalo, New York. However, the two continued to communicate through text messages for several months. On July 11, 2013, at approximately 7:18 p.m., Da’s fiancé received a final text message from him indicating that he was in trouble.

Case reference: 2006018099.CaseDesc: On January 4, 1994, David Ernest Rowbotham was last seen in the Belleville/Trenton Ontario area.

Case reference: 2023028547.CaseDesc: Maurice Boucher was last seen in the Montreal borough of Ville-Marie, Québec, on June 8, 2020. Maurice suffers from a number of health problems, including curved legs and has great difficulty getting around, walking with the aid of a walker or cane.  He is known for using housing resources for the homeless.

Case reference: 2022014288.CaseDesc: Lauren Craven was last seen by his family in Wildwood, Alberta on April 7th, 2022. Lauren was confirmed to be staying at the Grand Union Hotel in Coleman, Alberta from April 11th, 2022 till  check-out on June 16th, 2022. Lauren's vehicle was located abandoned near Sparwood, British Columbia on August 26, 2022 with a Lethbridge Prairie Post newspaper dated June 17th, 2022. Lauren was showing signs of early-onset dementia.

Case reference: 2014005988.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2013, Mark Clarke was seen for the last time in Kentville, Nova Scotia. It is out of character for Mark not to be in contact with his family for an extended period of time.

Case reference: 2014004972.CaseDesc: Asim Chaudhry was last seen leaving his residence on July 20, 2007 at 1400hrs to study for an upcoming exam at Simon Fraser University. Asim was despondent in the past.

Hair: Black, Brush Cut, Has a beard
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat Pant, Sweat pants
Sweater: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with "Russel Athletic" in red and blue writing

Case reference: 2015056570.CaseDesc: John Hastings left his sister's apartment in downtown Winnipeg, Manitoba, on October 15, 2015. John was feeling despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2006019699.CaseDesc:
Pierre Couture was last seen in Cowansville, Quebec. He may have been hiding from
authorities and has not been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2013000110.CaseDesc: Robert Gorassi is a full time resident in Toronto and was on an outing at Kinark Outdoor Centre where he was last seen at 4:30 p.m on October 25, 2012.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Grizzled beard, moustache & sideburns

Case reference: 2014001419.CaseDesc: On December 4th, 1993 Elizabeth Mitchell was seen for the last time at her residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Her abandoned vehicle was found later that morning near Tablerock, Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Elizabeth was despondent.

Scar: Shoulders, Surgical scar on left shoulder

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.
